value.0: I thank you for your aid. Were it not for your intervention, I surely would have perished in this treacherous place. What say you and me team up? It's the least I can do since you saved my life.
Of course. I'll be here for a little while to get my bearings if you change your mind. Farewell, and thank you again.
I will do my best to protect you from peril during our adventure together.
Did you need something?
Okay, moving on.
Thank you again for saving me. Farewell!
That is an excellent tactic. I will only attack enemies from afar with my flaming arrows.
If that is what you want.
I'm sorry, but I have already joined up with someone else.
<StartAction>[This elven man is gravely wounded. If you have a healing potion, you can administer it to him. Otherwise, you can attempt to heal him through spells or a healing kit.]</Start>
<StartHighlight>[He quickly quaffs the potion and it appears to be healing his wounds.]</Start>
<StartHighlight>[He quickly quaffs the potion and it appears to be healing his wounds.]</Start>
<StartHighlight>[He quickly quaffs the potion and it appears to be healing his wounds.]</Start>
<StartHighlight>[He quickly quaffs the potion and it appears to be healing his wounds.]</Start>

<StartAction>[This elven man is still needs more healing. If you have another healing potion, you can administer it to him. Otherwise, you can attempt to heal him through spells or a healing kit.]</Start>
Ha! It seems another fool has taken my bait! Kill them all, my creatures!
That's okay, I'm just glad I could help. Goodbye.
Good idea. Welcome to the party.
Not at the moment, no.
I think it's best if we split up.
<StartAction>[Leave.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Give him a Potion of Cure Light Wounds.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Give him a Potion of Cure Moderate Wounds.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Give him a Potion of Cure Serious Wounds.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Give him a Potion of Cure Critical Wounds.]</Start>
